page.title: 08TRANSPORT-YALDING & DISTRICT
page.content: Southern Wateringbury and Nettlestead are served by buses on the Maidstone- Paddock Wood-Tunbridge Wells route. There is a basic hourly service Mondays to Saturdays and 5 buses in each direction on Sundays. Yalding and West Farleigh are served by buses from Maidstone to various local villages (eg Laddingford, Horsmonden) on Mondays to Saturdays. There is no service on Sundays. Most services use Yalding Hill but 3 buses each way use Vicarage Road, Yalding. Last buses run at about 1800 hours. Traffic on the rivers and the canal is now all leisure traffic, apart from an occasional Southern Water Authority vessel. Hampstead Marina, close to Yalding station, and the riverside Wateringbury Marina both have a large number of moorings.
